examples: 'Don't be such a wally,' Ruby said. 'Felicity is way smarter than you could ever hope to be.'

entries.meaning: (colloquial, London and Essex) A large pickled gherkin or cucumber.
examples: Mushy peas (£1.40) are ... mushy, and wallies (45p) – pickled gherkins to you – come sliced and prettily served in the shape of a flower.

entries.meaning: (Of eyes) unusually pale; misaligned, sideways-looking, affected by strabismus.
examples: […]  one of his eyes was wally, a condition common among the natives of the land. (Here the first meaning is intended, as indicated later in the text:)  […]  turned his one black eye on the kindly man  […]  (p. 183)

entries.meaning: (colloquial, obsolete, Essex) Alternative pronunciation (and hence spelling) of value
examples: Let them that wallys the sheep watch 'em.
